Calendar

  1. News & Events
    What's happening in Glenwood Springs
  1. Recent News
  2. Upcoming Events
  1. Recent News

  1. CONE ZONE: 27th Street Bridge April 11 & 12

    Soil nail walls are now complete on both the east and west sides of the bridge. Crews have now shifted focus to micropile construction which essentially make up the new bridge abutments. Read on...

  2. Spring Cleanup 2019

    The City of Glenwood Springs will be holding this year’s annual Spring Cleanup event April 15 to May 17, 2019. Read on...

  3. Unofficial Election Results

    Glenwood Springs municipal election unofficial voting results Read on...

  4. A Letter on Potholes from your Public Works Director

    Public Works Director, Matt Langhorst, addresses potholes in Glenwood Springs Read on...

  5. CONE ZONE: 27th St. Bridge Micropile Construction to Begin March 18

    Soil nail walls are nearing completion and crews are set to begin micropile construction on Monday, March 18. With this new work activity, expect to see some changes to project impacts. Read on...

  6. Convenience fee for credit/debit card use to begin March 4

    Read on...

  7. Ride Glenwood - Bus Stop Closure - 27th St Bridge

    Beginning Monday, 4/22, Ride Glenwood Springs will no longer service the bus stops located on 27th Street between SH-82 and South Grand Avenue due to 27th Street Bridge construction. The closest available stop is at the 27th St BRT station.

  8. Bicycle Friendly Driver Training is Coming to Glenwood Springs!

    Bicycle Colorado and the City of Glenwood Springs are teaming up to provide FREE Bicycle Friendly Driver training at the Glenwood Springs Library on May 6! Read on...
View All >

/Calendar.aspx
  1. In the Spotlight
    The latest information from your community

  1. Visitor Information

    Looking for a new place to visit? Look no further! Glenwood Springs, Colorado is a family friendly vacation destination located 40 miles north of Aspen and 60 miles west of Vail. Additional Info...

  2. Parks and Recreation Spotlight

    We are excited to offer a variety of programs for your recreational needs. The Parks Department maintains 15 developed parks, totaling over 100 acres and over 4,000 acres of open space. Additional Info...

  3. Environmental Programs

    The City of Glenwood Springs is committed to environmental awareness issues. Look for more information on how you can participate in keeping our valley clean and safe for future generations.
/CivicAlerts.aspx
